adverbs.description: affectedly (comparative more affectedly, superlative most affectedly)

entries.meaning: In an affected manner; hypocritically; with more show than reality.
examples: The speech is the Image of the minde: if a man mince it, disguise and polish it ouer curiously, it is a signe that he which speaketh it, is an hypocrite, and little worth. It is no manly ornament to speake affectedly.
One not hasty to pursue the new Fashion, nor yet affectedly true to his old round Breeches.

[…]  the Excelsi or high places mentioned in the sacred Story, wherein the Heathen performed idolatrous rites unto their Idols, were commonly groves, affectedly sited upon some mountainous place, without any House or Temple.
